title: Introduction to pkgsnip
text: (R) Markdown file snippets can used anywhere (R) Markdown input supported. example, can use input knitr’s child document option: inserting snippets require name calling package like "pkg-instl-dev-gitlab.Rmd", either use pal::build_readme() build .Rmd file manually assign pkg_metadata <- pal::desc_list() environment passed devtools::build_rmd() ... argument respectively. can also use snippets roxygen2’s @includeRmd tag: snippets require name calling package, just assign pkg_metadata () inserting snippet(s), e.g. like :

title: Introduction to pkgsnip
text: Currently, following R Markdown file snippets included: _common.Rmd funky-config.Rmd pkg-code-style.Rmd pkg-desc.Rmd pkg-instl-dev-gitlab.Rmd pkg-instl-dev.Rmd pkgpurl.Rmd

title: Introduction to pkgsnip
text: Markdown snippets basically serve purpose R Markdown file snippets , geared towards shorter content semantics slightly differ. support glue’s string interpolation via curly braces, .e. embedded R code allows dynamic content. snippets can used roxygen2 documentation via inline R code follows: result
code: #' Awesome function title #' #' Awesome function description. #' #' `r pkgsnip::md_snip("rstudio_addin")` #' Awesome function title #' #' Awesome function description. #' #' This function is registered as an [RStudio add-in](https://rstudio.github.io/rstudioaddins/), allowing RStudio users to assign a [custom shortcut](https://support.posit.co/hc/en-us/articles/206382178-Customizing-Keyboard-Shortcuts-in-the-RStudio-IDE) to it and to invoke it from the [command palette](https://posit.co/blog/rstudio-1-4-a-quick-tour/#command-palette-shortcuts).

title: Introduction to pkgsnip
text: Currently, following Markdown snippets included:

title: Introduction to pkgsnip
text: roxygen2 tag labels specifically meant @-tag-based documentation using inline R code. Insert functions using inline R code, e.g. follows result
code: #' @param use_cache `r pkgsnip::param_lbl("use_cache")` #' @param max_cache_age `r pkgsnip::param_lbl("max_cache_age")` #' @return `r pkgsnip::return_lbl("tibble")` #' @param use_cache Whether or not to return cached results if possible. If `FALSE`, results are always newly fetched regardless of `max_cache_age`. #' @param max_cache_age Duration after which cached results are refreshed (i.e. newly fetched). A valid [lubridate duration][lubridate::as.duration]. Use `Inf` to disable cache expiry. Only relevant if `use_cache = TRUE`. #' @return A [tibble][tibble::tbl_df].

title: Introduction to pkgsnip
text: Finally, ’s table included lists (opinionated) set abbreviations commonly used writing R code. might come handy reference, example, check availability considering using abbreviation function argument name. table can retrieved calling pkgsnip::abbrs() currently looks follows (click expand):

title: Authors and Citation
text: Salim Brüggemann. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brüggemann S (2025). pkgsnip: Standardized roxygen2 Labels (R) Markdown Snippets Package Authors. R package version 0.0.9037, https://pkgsnip.rpkg.dev.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pkgsnip: Standardized roxygen2 Labels and (R) Markdown Snippets for Package Authors},   author = {Salim Brüggemann},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.9037},   url = {https://pkgsnip.rpkg.dev}, }

what: Standardized roxygen2 Labels and (R) Markdown Snippets for Package Authors
title: Standardized roxygen2 Labels and (R) Markdown Snippets for Package Authors
text: pkgsnip ships ready--go (R) Markdown snippets labels intended used roxygen2 documentation knitr child documents. Also included predefined R condition messages table abbreviations commonly used R code. designed reduce unnecessary repetition standardize R package documentation wherever possible.

title: Standardized roxygen2 Labels and (R) Markdown Snippets for Package Authors
text: install latest development version pkgsnip, run following R:

title: Standardized roxygen2 Labels and (R) Markdown Snippets for Package Authors
text: introduction package given . (function) reference found .

title: Standardized roxygen2 Labels and (R) Markdown Snippets for Package Authors
text: package’s source code written R Markdown file format facilitate practices commonly referred literate programming. allows actual code freely mixed explanatory supplementary information expressive Markdown format instead rely # comments . .gen.R suffixed R source code found R/ generated respective R Markdown counterparts Rmd/ using pkgpurl::purl_rmd()1. Always make changes .Rmd files – never .R files – run pkgpurl::purl_rmd() regenerate R source files.

title: Standardized roxygen2 Labels and (R) Markdown Snippets for Package Authors
text: package borrows lot Tidyverse design philosophies. R code guided Tidy design principles formatted according Tidyverse Style Guide (TSG) following exceptions: Line width limited 160 characters, double limit proposed TSG (80 characters ridiculously little given today’s high-resolution wide screen monitors). Furthermore, preferred style breaking long lines differs. Instead wrapping directly expression’s opening bracket suggested TSG, prefer two fewer line breaks indent subsequent lines within expression opening bracket: results less vertical horizontal spread code better readability pipes. Usage magrittr’s compound assignment pipe-operator %<>% desirable2. Usage R’s right-hand assignment operator -> allowed3. R source code split several files suggested TSG instead (far possible) kept single file Rmd/pkgsnip.Rmd well-structured thanks Markdown support. far possible, deviations TSG plus additional restrictions formally specified pkgpurl::default_linters, (default) used pkgpurl::lint_rmd(), turn recommended way lint package.
code: # TSG proposes this do_something_very_complicated(   something = "that",   requires = many,   arguments = "some of which may be long" )  # we prefer this do_something_very_complicated(something = "that",                               requires = many,                               arguments = "some of which may be long")

text: avoid list getting excessively long redundant, main focus verbs nouns. Adjectives adverbs listed column full_expression already verb noun root word listed particular abbreviation. means e.g. abbreviation "seq" also stand full expressions "sequential" "sequentially", despite fact explicitly listed merely verb/noun "sequence" .

text: quote Leon Bambrick: "2 hard problems computer science: cache invalidation, naming things, --1 errors."

title: Type hints — data_types
text: tibble R object type hints together id. latter can fed type().

title: Type hints — data_types
text: tibble columns id, value, is_scalar.

title: Type hints — data_types
code: pkgsnip::data_types #> # A tibble: 11 × 3 #>    id      value                                               is_scalar #>    <chr>   <chr>                                               <lgl>     #>  1 chr     [`character({length})`][base::character]            TRUE      #>  2 date    [`Date`][base::Date]                                FALSE     #>  3 df      [`data.frame`][base::data.frame]                    FALSE     #>  4 fct     [`factor`][base::factor]                            FALSE     #>  5 int     [`integer({length})`][base::integer]                TRUE      #>  6 lgl     [`logical({length})`][base::logical]                TRUE      #>  7 list    [`list()`][base::list]                              FALSE     #>  8 mat     [`matrix()`][base::matrix]                          FALSE     #>  9 num     [`numeric({length})`][base::numeric]                TRUE      #> 10 pg_conn [`PqConnection`][RPostgres::dbGetInfo_PqConnection] FALSE     #> 11 raw     [`raw({length})`][base::raw]                        TRUE

title: Get predefined @description label — description_lbl
text: Returns predefined label intended used function's description using roxygen2's @description tag. Shorthand roxy_lbl(type = "description").

title: Get predefined @description label — description_lbl
text: id Label identifier. See roxy_lbls() possible values. ... named arguments passed roxy_lbl().

title: Get predefined @description label — description_lbl
text: glue character scalar.

title: Get predefined @description label — description_lbl
text: label can inserted using inline R code follows:   Note works roxygen2 7.1.0+. Currently, following @description labels available: Note pkg argument defaults name package function called (NULL run within package environment).

title: Get predefined @description label — description_lbl
code: pkgsnip::description_lbl(id = "dyn_dots_support") #> [Dynamic dots][rlang::dyn-dots] are supported.  # some labels take additional arguments pkgsnip::description_lbl(id = "opt_global_max_cache_age",                          global_max_cache_age = "6h",                          pkg = "foo") #> Note that [on package load][base::ns-hooks], the cache will be cleared from entries exceeding a global maximum timespan set by the \R [option][base::options()] `foo.global_max_cache_age` (defaults to `6h` if unset).  # note that the `pkg` argument always defaults to the current package # (none if run from the global environment) pkgsnip::description_lbl(id = "opt_global_max_cache_age",                          global_max_cache_age = "6h") #> Note that [on package load][base::ns-hooks], the cache will be cleared from entries exceeding a global maximum timespan set by the \R [option][base::options()] `pkgsnip.global_max_cache_age` (defaults to `6h` if unset).

title: Get predefined Markdown snippet — md_snip
text: Returns predefined Markdown snippet.

title: Get predefined Markdown snippet — md_snip
text: id Snippet identifier. One "funky_config", "opt_global_max_cache_age", "pkg_required", "pkg_usage", "pkgdown_site" "rstudio_addin". env Environment inline code evaluated, e.g. base::parent.frame(), base::new.env(), base::globalenv(). ... named arguments used tailor snippet needs. snippets require additional arguments, see data_md_snips overview. required argument explicitly provided, searched parent frames.

title: Get predefined Markdown snippet — md_snip
text: character scalar.

title: Get predefined Markdown snippet — md_snip
text: Currently, following Markdown snippets available: Note pkg argument defaults name package function called (NULL run within package environment).

title: Get predefined Markdown snippet — md_snip
code: pkgsnip::md_snip(id = "rstudio_addin") |> cat() #> This function is registered as an [RStudio add-in](https://rstudio.github.io/rstudioaddins/), allowing RStudio users to assign a [custom shortcut](https://support.posit.co/hc/en-us/articles/206382178-Customizing-Keyboard-Shortcuts-in-the-RStudio-IDE) to it and to invoke it from the [command palette](https://posit.co/blog/rstudio-1-4-a-quick-tour/#command-palette-shortcuts).  # certain snips require additional args pkgsnip::md_snip(id = "funky_config",                  pkg = "foo") |>   cat() #> Some of foo's functionality is controlled via package-specific global configuration which can either be set via [R options](https://rdrr.io/r/base/options.html) or [environment variables](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Environment_variable) (the former take precedence). This configuration includes:

title: Get predefined @param label — param_lbl
text: Returns predefined label intended used document function parameter using roxygen2's @param tag. Shorthand roxy_lbl(type = "param").

title: Get predefined @param label — param_lbl
text: id Label identifier. See roxy_lbls() possible values. ... named arguments passed roxy_lbl().

title: Get predefined @param label — param_lbl
text: glue character scalar.

title: Get predefined @param label — param_lbl
text: label can inserted using inline R code follows:   Note works roxygen2 7.1.0+. Currently, following parameter labels available: Note pkg argument defaults name package function called (NULL run within package environment).

title: Get predefined @param label — param_lbl
code:
pkgsnip::param_lbl(id = "eol") #> End of line (EOL) control character sequence. One of #> - `"LF"` for the line feed (LF) character (`"
"`). The standard on Unix and Unix-like systems (Linux, macOS, *BSD, etc.) and the **default**. #> - `"CRLF"` for the carriage return + line feed (CR+LF) character sequence (`"
"`). The standard on Microsoft Windows, DOS and some other systems. #> - `"CR"` for the carriage return (CR) character (`""`). The standard on classic Mac OS and some other antiquated systems. #> - `"LFCR"` for the line feed + carriage return (LF+CR) character sequence (`"
"`). The standard on RISC OS and some other exotic systems.  # some labels take additional arguments pkgsnip::param_lbl(id = "http_method",                    one_of = c("GET", "POST")) #> [HTTP request method](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Methods). #>   One of GET or POST.

what: pkgsnip: Standardized roxygen2 Labels and (R) Markdown Snippets for Package Authors — pkgsnip-package
title: pkgsnip: Standardized roxygen2 Labels and (R) Markdown Snippets for Package Authors — pkgsnip-package
text: pkgsnip ships ready--go (R) Markdown snippets labels intended used roxygen2 documentation knitr child documents. Also included predefined R condition messages table abbreviations commonly used R code. designed reduce unnecessary repetition standardize R package documentation wherever possible.

title: pkgsnip: Standardized roxygen2 Labels and (R) Markdown Snippets for Package Authors — pkgsnip-package
text: Maintainer: Salim Brüggemann salim@rpkg.dev (ORCID)

title: Get predefined @return label — return_lbl
text: Returns predefined label intended used document function return values using roxygen2's @return tag. Shorthand roxy_lbl(type = "return").

title: Get predefined @return label — return_lbl
text: id Label identifier. See roxy_lbls() possible values. ... named arguments passed roxy_lbl().

title: Get predefined @return label — return_lbl
text: glue character scalar.

title: Get predefined @return label — return_lbl
text: label can inserted using inline R code follows:   Note works roxygen2 7.1.0+. Currently, following return labels available: Note pkg argument defaults name package function called (NULL run within package environment).

title: Get predefined @return label — return_lbl
code: pkgsnip::return_lbl(id = "dyn_dots_support") #> [Dynamic dots][rlang::dyn-dots] are supported.  # some labels take additional arguments pkgsnip::return_lbl(id = "funky_config",                     pkg = "foo") #> A [tibble][tibble::tbl_df] with data about all possible foo package configuration options. See [funky::config_val()] for more information.  # note that the `pkg` argument always defaults to the current package # (none if run from the global environment) pkgsnip::return_lbl(id = "funky_config") #> A [tibble][tibble::tbl_df] with data about all possible pkgsnip package configuration options. See [funky::config_val()] for more information.

what: Get predefined roxygen2 tag label — roxy_lbl
title: Get predefined roxygen2 tag label — roxy_lbl
text: Returns predefined label intended used document functions using roxygen2 tags.

title: Get predefined roxygen2 tag label — roxy_lbl
code: roxy_lbl(   id = roxy_lbls()$id,   type = "default",   as_sentence = TRUE,   env = parent.frame(),   ... )

title: Get predefined roxygen2 tag label — roxy_lbl
text: id Label identifier. See roxy_lbls() possible values. type label type return label value . One "default", "author", "concept", "description", "details", "field", "format", "keywords", "param", "references", "return", "section", "seealso", "slot", "source" "title". as_sentence Whether format resulting string full sentence, .e. first letter capitalized period end. env Environment inline code evaluated, e.g. base::parent.frame(), base::new.env(), base::globalenv(). ... named arguments used tailor label needs. labels require additional arguments, see roxy_lbls() overview. required argument explicitly provided, searched parent frames.

title: Get predefined roxygen2 tag label — roxy_lbl
text: glue character scalar.

title: Get predefined roxygen2 tag label — roxy_lbl
text: labels can inserted using inline R code follows:   Note works roxygen2 7.1.0+.

title: Get predefined roxygen2 tag label — roxy_lbl
code: pkgsnip::roxy_lbl(id = "cli_markup_support") #> Supports cli's [inline markup][cli::inline-markup].  # some labels take additional arguments pkgsnip::roxy_lbl(id = "opt_global_max_cache_age",                   global_max_cache_age = "6h",                   pkg = "foo") #> Note that [on package load][base::ns-hooks], the cache will be cleared from entries exceeding a global maximum timespan set by the \R [option][base::options()] `foo.global_max_cache_age` (defaults to `6h` if unset).  # note that the `pkg` argument always defaults to the current package # (none if run from the global environment) pkgsnip::roxy_lbl(id = "opt_global_max_cache_age",                   global_max_cache_age = "6h") #> Note that [on package load][base::ns-hooks], the cache will be cleared from entries exceeding a global maximum timespan set by the \R [option][base::options()] `.global_max_cache_age` (defaults to `6h` if unset).
